  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          align-items: stretch;

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)

        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I hope this report finds you well. :o)<span class="line"><!---->I hope this report finds you well. :o)<!----></span><br><br>Just for your kind information an inconsistent behaviour regarding the handling of secure protecting passwords, which are entrusted to Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Just for your kind information an inconsistent behaviour regarding the handling of secure protecting passwords, which are entrusted to Chrome<!----></span><br><br>• Chrome v115.0.5777.2<span class="line"><!---->• Chrome v115.0.5777.2<!----></span><br>• Android 13 patchlevel 01.05.2023<span class="line"><!---->• Android 13 patchlevel 01.05.2023<!----></span><br><br>First, <span class="line"><!---->First, <!----></span><br><br>1. Go to => settings => password manager => passwords<span class="line"><!---->1. Go to =&gt; settings =&gt; password manager =&gt; passwords<!----></span><br>2. Select an already stored account.<span class="line"><!---->2. Select an already stored account.<!----></span><br>3. You see the page for changing the password containing details to the service and the account name as well. The password is masked.<span class="line"><!---->3. You see the page for changing the password containing details to the service and the account name as well. The password is masked.<!----></span><br>4. Try taking a screenshot(*) => allowed.<span class="line"><!---->4. Try taking a screenshot(*) =&gt; allowed.<!----></span><br><br>Step #4 is okay, because the password is masked, thus no sensible data extractable.<span class="line"><!---->Step #4 is okay, because the password is masked, thus no sensible data extractable.<!----></span><br><br>5. Press the eye symbol next to the masked password<span class="line"><!---->5. Press the eye symbol next to the masked password<!----></span><br>6. Chrome prompts for authentication<span class="line"><!---->6. Chrome prompts for authentication<!----></span><br>7. Do authenticate<span class="line"><!---->7. Do authenticate<!----></span><br>8. Now you can see the password in plain text<span class="line"><!---->8. Now you can see the password in plain text<!----></span><br>9. Try taking a screenshot(*) => Forbidden.<span class="line"><!---->9. Try taking a screenshot(*) =&gt; Forbidden.<!----></span><br>_____<span class="line"><!---->_____<!----></span><br>(*) Screenshot = Android function, not the ones offered in the sharing menu.<span class="line"><!---->(*) Screenshot = Android function, not the ones offered in the sharing menu.<!----></span><br><br>Step #9 is well thought and obviously working perfect, as a malicious app/service/whatever instead could secretly take a screenshot of my passwords and transfer it for his benefit to attacker controlled servers.<span class="line"><!---->Step #9 is well thought and obviously working perfect, as a malicious app/service/whatever instead could secretly take a screenshot of my passwords and transfer it for his benefit to attacker controlled servers.<!----></span><br><br>Problem:<span class="line"><!---->Problem:<!----></span><br>========<span class="line"><!---->========<!----></span><br><br>The nature of the password manager is helping me, the user, filling out for example login forms. Those forms do generally contain masked password input fields, in my experiences. Next to these input fields are mostly a kind of toggle (eye symbol, checkbox etc) for unhiding/unmasking the password. As a user, I can then see my password then.<span class="line"><!---->The nature of the password manager is helping me, the user, filling out for example login forms. Those forms do generally contain masked password input fields, in my experiences. Next to these input fields are mostly a kind of toggle (eye symbol, checkbox etc) for unhiding/unmasking the password. As a user, I can then see my password then.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately, exactly when the password is unmasked, malicious code is not hindered by Chrome from taking screenshots. The attacker can uncońcernedly get hold of my login details including the web page and transfer them for his benefit.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately, exactly when the password is unmasked, malicious code is not hindered by Chrome from taking screenshots. The attacker can uncońcernedly get hold of my login details including the web page and transfer them for his benefit.<!----></span><br><br>Expectation:<span class="line"><!---->Expectation:<!----></span><br>===========<span class="line"><!---->===========<!----></span><br><br>Parallel to unhiding/unmasking passwords, Chrome has to hinder taking screenshots. That is obviously possible, as the proof from step #9 is stating (I assume it was implemented in step #9 for security reasons, at the point someone already had assessed this in former times as a clear risk).<span class="line"><!---->Parallel to unhiding/unmasking passwords, Chrome has to hinder taking screenshots. That is obviously possible, as the proof from step #9 is stating (I assume it was implemented in step #9 for security reasons, at the point someone already had assessed this in former times as a clear risk).<!----></span><br><br>Without having better knowledge, I assume that Chrome is already knowing whether such a textbox of the kind "password" is shown unmasked or not, thus able to set the neccessary copy protection secure flag.<span class="line"><!---->Without having better knowledge, I assume that Chrome is already knowing whether such a textbox of the kind "password" is shown unmasked or not, thus able to set the neccessary copy protection secure flag.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>Just for precaution: I'm _not_ talking about a local attack, but about malicious/sniffing apps secretly monitoring the screen in the background. Yes, the user must of course have it installed, but then he can no longer install an app. Or an app was installed drive-by in the web or by a deep link to an authorized (unprotected) system app. Any developer can become the victim of a cyber attack and/or his certificates be lost, the developer sold to a bad actor etc etc etc. Suddenly an innocently appearing update is containing harmful functions ...<span class="line"><!---->Just for precaution: I'm _not_ talking about a local attack, but about malicious/sniffing apps secretly monitoring the screen in the background. Yes, the user must of course have it installed, but then he can no longer install an app. Or an app was installed drive-by in the web or by a deep link to an authorized (unprotected) system app. Any developer can become the victim of a cyber attack and/or his certificates be lost, the developer sold to a bad actor etc etc etc. Suddenly an innocently appearing update is containing harmful functions ...<!----></span><br>Not all users and/or services are offering/using 2FA. And passwords are mostly used more than with just one service.<span class="line"><!---->Not all users and/or services are offering/using 2FA. And passwords are mostly used more than with just one service.<!----></span><br><br>Aren't apps considered as "remote"?<span class="line"><!---->Aren't apps considered as "remote"?<!----></span><br><br>A thousand thanks for checking and fixing on occasion - for my security and naturally the security of billions of users all-over-the-world.<span class="line"><!---->A thousand thanks for checking and fixing on occasion - for my security and naturally the security of billions of users all-over-the-world.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>

        Thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>This is not something we would consider a security flaw, since restrictions around screen capture like that are best effort client-side mitigations, so I'm changing this to a normal bug. I'll let the password manager team consider the suggestion to prevent screen capture when an unmasked password is visible on a page.<span class="line"><!---->This is not something we would consider a security flaw, since restrictions around screen capture like that are best effort client-side mitigations, so I'm changing this to a normal bug. I'll let the password manager team consider the suggestion to prevent screen capture when an unmasked password is visible on a page.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Thanks a lot.<span class="line"><!---->? Thanks a lot.<!----></span><br><br>Regarding you question: See attachment, taken on a sample page; same behaviour on many other webpages.<span class="line"><!---->Regarding you question: See attachment, taken on a sample page; same behaviour on many other webpages.<!----></span><br><br>(Besides, please put into balance, that even if the password is masked, it can also be captured by recording the screen which is showing the typed letters on the soft keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->(Besides, please put into balance, that even if the password is masked, it can also be captured by recording the screen which is showing the typed letters on the soft keyboard.<!----></span><br>But that is another issue).<span class="line"><!---->But that is another issue).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just some thoughts regarding password screens under Android (I know, that is another screen, but the effects are in my sight the same):<span class="line"><!---->Just some thoughts regarding password screens under Android (I know, that is another screen, but the effects are in my sight the same):<!----></span><br><br>* CVE-2022-20245 aka A-215005011 **severity HIGH**<span class="line"><!---->* CVE-2022-20245 aka A-215005011 **severity HIGH**<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13"><!---->https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13<!----></a><br>  > Update window with FLAG_SECURE when bouncer is showing | This will prevent bouncer interactions from showing up in screenrecords or screenshots.<span class="line"><!---->  &gt; Update window with FLAG_SECURE when bouncer is showing | This will prevent bouncer interactions from showing up in screenrecords or screenshots.<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245"><!---->https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245<!----></a><br>    > In WindowManager, there is a possible method to create a recording of the lock screen due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; In WindowManager, there is a possible method to create a recording of the lock screen due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<!----></span><br>    <span class="line"><!---->    <!----></span><br>* CVE-2022-20466 aka A-179725730 **severity HIGH**<span class="line"><!---->* CVE-2022-20466 aka A-179725730 **severity HIGH**<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466"><!---->https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466<!----></a><br>   > In applyKeyguardFlags of NotificationShadeWindowControllerImpl.java, there is a possible way to observe the user's password on a secondary display due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<span class="line"><!---->   &gt; In applyKeyguardFlags of NotificationShadeWindowControllerImpl.java, there is a possible way to observe the user's password on a secondary display due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01"><!---->https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01<!----></a><br>   > Add FLAG_SECURE for ChooseLockPassword and Pattern | Prevent ChooseLockPassword and ChooseLockPatten being projected to remote views, add FLAG_SECURE for these screens.<span class="line"><!---->   &gt; Add FLAG_SECURE for ChooseLockPassword and Pattern | Prevent ChooseLockPassword and ChooseLockPatten being projected to remote views, add FLAG_SECURE for these screens.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {

    background: var(--chops-white);

    margin: 0;

  }

  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {

  }

    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    align-items: flex-start;

    font-weight: bold;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

 }
 }
 });

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-header></mr-header>
      <chops-announcement service="monorail"></chops-announcement>
      <mr-site-banner hidden=""></mr-site-banner>

          <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }

          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      
      
        
          
      
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)
      </option>

          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hesse...@googlemail.com (May 18, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      Hello together,<span class="line"><!---->Hello together,<!----></span><br><br>I hope this report finds you well. :o)<span class="line"><!---->I hope this report finds you well. :o)<!----></span><br><br>Just for your kind information an inconsistent behaviour regarding the handling of secure protecting passwords, which are entrusted to Chrome<span class="line"><!---->Just for your kind information an inconsistent behaviour regarding the handling of secure protecting passwords, which are entrusted to Chrome<!----></span><br><br>• Chrome v115.0.5777.2<span class="line"><!---->• Chrome v115.0.5777.2<!----></span><br>• Android 13 patchlevel 01.05.2023<span class="line"><!---->• Android 13 patchlevel 01.05.2023<!----></span><br><br>First, <span class="line"><!---->First, <!----></span><br><br>1. Go to => settings => password manager => passwords<span class="line"><!---->1. Go to =&gt; settings =&gt; password manager =&gt; passwords<!----></span><br>2. Select an already stored account.<span class="line"><!---->2. Select an already stored account.<!----></span><br>3. You see the page for changing the password containing details to the service and the account name as well. The password is masked.<span class="line"><!---->3. You see the page for changing the password containing details to the service and the account name as well. The password is masked.<!----></span><br>4. Try taking a screenshot(*) => allowed.<span class="line"><!---->4. Try taking a screenshot(*) =&gt; allowed.<!----></span><br><br>Step #4 is okay, because the password is masked, thus no sensible data extractable.<span class="line"><!---->Step #4 is okay, because the password is masked, thus no sensible data extractable.<!----></span><br><br>5. Press the eye symbol next to the masked password<span class="line"><!---->5. Press the eye symbol next to the masked password<!----></span><br>6. Chrome prompts for authentication<span class="line"><!---->6. Chrome prompts for authentication<!----></span><br>7. Do authenticate<span class="line"><!---->7. Do authenticate<!----></span><br>8. Now you can see the password in plain text<span class="line"><!---->8. Now you can see the password in plain text<!----></span><br>9. Try taking a screenshot(*) => Forbidden.<span class="line"><!---->9. Try taking a screenshot(*) =&gt; Forbidden.<!----></span><br>_____<span class="line"><!---->_____<!----></span><br>(*) Screenshot = Android function, not the ones offered in the sharing menu.<span class="line"><!---->(*) Screenshot = Android function, not the ones offered in the sharing menu.<!----></span><br><br>Step #9 is well thought and obviously working perfect, as a malicious app/service/whatever instead could secretly take a screenshot of my passwords and transfer it for his benefit to attacker controlled servers.<span class="line"><!---->Step #9 is well thought and obviously working perfect, as a malicious app/service/whatever instead could secretly take a screenshot of my passwords and transfer it for his benefit to attacker controlled servers.<!----></span><br><br>Problem:<span class="line"><!---->Problem:<!----></span><br>========<span class="line"><!---->========<!----></span><br><br>The nature of the password manager is helping me, the user, filling out for example login forms. Those forms do generally contain masked password input fields, in my experiences. Next to these input fields are mostly a kind of toggle (eye symbol, checkbox etc) for unhiding/unmasking the password. As a user, I can then see my password then.<span class="line"><!---->The nature of the password manager is helping me, the user, filling out for example login forms. Those forms do generally contain masked password input fields, in my experiences. Next to these input fields are mostly a kind of toggle (eye symbol, checkbox etc) for unhiding/unmasking the password. As a user, I can then see my password then.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately, exactly when the password is unmasked, malicious code is not hindered by Chrome from taking screenshots. The attacker can uncońcernedly get hold of my login details including the web page and transfer them for his benefit.<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately, exactly when the password is unmasked, malicious code is not hindered by Chrome from taking screenshots. The attacker can uncońcernedly get hold of my login details including the web page and transfer them for his benefit.<!----></span><br><br>Expectation:<span class="line"><!---->Expectation:<!----></span><br>===========<span class="line"><!---->===========<!----></span><br><br>Parallel to unhiding/unmasking passwords, Chrome has to hinder taking screenshots. That is obviously possible, as the proof from step #9 is stating (I assume it was implemented in step #9 for security reasons, at the point someone already had assessed this in former times as a clear risk).<span class="line"><!---->Parallel to unhiding/unmasking passwords, Chrome has to hinder taking screenshots. That is obviously possible, as the proof from step #9 is stating (I assume it was implemented in step #9 for security reasons, at the point someone already had assessed this in former times as a clear risk).<!----></span><br><br>Without having better knowledge, I assume that Chrome is already knowing whether such a textbox of the kind "password" is shown unmasked or not, thus able to set the neccessary copy protection secure flag.<span class="line"><!---->Without having better knowledge, I assume that Chrome is already knowing whether such a textbox of the kind "password" is shown unmasked or not, thus able to set the neccessary copy protection secure flag.<!----></span><br><br><br><br>Just for precaution: I'm _not_ talking about a local attack, but about malicious/sniffing apps secretly monitoring the screen in the background. Yes, the user must of course have it installed, but then he can no longer install an app. Or an app was installed drive-by in the web or by a deep link to an authorized (unprotected) system app. Any developer can become the victim of a cyber attack and/or his certificates be lost, the developer sold to a bad actor etc etc etc. Suddenly an innocently appearing update is containing harmful functions ...<span class="line"><!---->Just for precaution: I'm _not_ talking about a local attack, but about malicious/sniffing apps secretly monitoring the screen in the background. Yes, the user must of course have it installed, but then he can no longer install an app. Or an app was installed drive-by in the web or by a deep link to an authorized (unprotected) system app. Any developer can become the victim of a cyber attack and/or his certificates be lost, the developer sold to a bad actor etc etc etc. Suddenly an innocently appearing update is containing harmful functions ...<!----></span><br>Not all users and/or services are offering/using 2FA. And passwords are mostly used more than with just one service.<span class="line"><!---->Not all users and/or services are offering/using 2FA. And passwords are mostly used more than with just one service.<!----></span><br><br>Aren't apps considered as "remote"?<span class="line"><!---->Aren't apps considered as "remote"?<!----></span><br><br>A thousand thanks for checking and fixing on occasion - for my security and naturally the security of billions of users all-over-the-world.<span class="line"><!---->A thousand thanks for checking and fixing on occasion - for my security and naturally the security of billions of users all-over-the-world.<!----></span><br><br>Best regards<span class="line"><!---->Best regards<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>

        Thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>This is not something we would consider a security flaw, since restrictions around screen capture like that are best effort client-side mitigations, so I'm changing this to a normal bug. I'll let the password manager team consider the suggestion to prevent screen capture when an unmasked password is visible on a page.<span class="line"><!---->This is not something we would consider a security flaw, since restrictions around screen capture like that are best effort client-side mitigations, so I'm changing this to a normal bug. I'll let the password manager team consider the suggestion to prevent screen capture when an unmasked password is visible on a page.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Thanks a lot.<span class="line"><!---->? Thanks a lot.<!----></span><br><br>Regarding you question: See attachment, taken on a sample page; same behaviour on many other webpages.<span class="line"><!---->Regarding you question: See attachment, taken on a sample page; same behaviour on many other webpages.<!----></span><br><br>(Besides, please put into balance, that even if the password is masked, it can also be captured by recording the screen which is showing the typed letters on the soft keyboard.<span class="line"><!---->(Besides, please put into balance, that even if the password is masked, it can also be captured by recording the screen which is showing the typed letters on the soft keyboard.<!----></span><br>But that is another issue).<span class="line"><!---->But that is another issue).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Just some thoughts regarding password screens under Android (I know, that is another screen, but the effects are in my sight the same):<span class="line"><!---->Just some thoughts regarding password screens under Android (I know, that is another screen, but the effects are in my sight the same):<!----></span><br><br>* CVE-2022-20245 aka A-215005011 **severity HIGH**<span class="line"><!---->* CVE-2022-20245 aka A-215005011 **severity HIGH**<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13"><!---->https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/android-13<!----></a><br>  > Update window with FLAG_SECURE when bouncer is showing | This will prevent bouncer interactions from showing up in screenrecords or screenshots.<span class="line"><!---->  &gt; Update window with FLAG_SECURE when bouncer is showing | This will prevent bouncer interactions from showing up in screenrecords or screenshots.<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245"><!---->https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20245<!----></a><br>    > In WindowManager, there is a possible method to create a recording of the lock screen due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<span class="line"><!---->    &gt; In WindowManager, there is a possible method to create a recording of the lock screen due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<!----></span><br>    <span class="line"><!---->    <!----></span><br>* CVE-2022-20466 aka A-179725730 **severity HIGH**<span class="line"><!---->* CVE-2022-20466 aka A-179725730 **severity HIGH**<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466"><!---->https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2022-20466<!----></a><br>   > In applyKeyguardFlags of NotificationShadeWindowControllerImpl.java, there is a possible way to observe the user's password on a secondary display due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<span class="line"><!---->   &gt; In applyKeyguardFlags of NotificationShadeWindowControllerImpl.java, there is a possible way to observe the user's password on a secondary display due to an insecure default value. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.<!----></span><br>  - <span class="line"><!---->  - <!----></span>https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01"><!---->https://source.android.com/security/bulletin/2022-12-01<!----></a><br>   > Add FLAG_SECURE for ChooseLockPassword and Pattern | Prevent ChooseLockPassword and ChooseLockPatten being projected to remote views, add FLAG_SECURE for these screens.<span class="line"><!---->   &gt; Add FLAG_SECURE for ChooseLockPassword and Pattern | Prevent ChooseLockPassword and ChooseLockPatten being projected to remote views, add FLAG_SECURE for these screens.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
